alert.note: Alert for Chilton (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 4:57PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Chilton County through 545 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Parnell, or 12 miles north of Valley Grande, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clanton, Thorsby, Maplesville, Billingsley, Plecher, Parnell, Pooles Crossroads, Lomax, Stanton and Isabella. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central and south central Alabama.
